channel.title: [Delta]Picking up custom item
channel.description: When I drop a custom item, before it says 'Take', it says '..' How can I remove this?

item.title: [Delta]Picking up custom item
item.dc:creator: @gangsta_tony gangsta tony
item.description:
@gangsta_tony wrote:

[quote=“mista pnut, post:5, topic:454198”]Only thing I’ve been able to come up with is in the client class, client sided.

Search for(int j3 = 4; j3 >= 0; j3–)

Everything below that is for dropped items. Take, examine, etc… But I cannot figure out what is wrong with it. Mine has the … above the take option and it looks like this.

[code=java]
for(int j3 = 4; j3 >= 0; j3–)
if(class8.aStringArray168 != null && class8.aStringArray168[j3] != null)
{
aStringArray1199[anInt1133] = class8.aStringArray168[j3] + " @lre@" + class8.aString170;
if(j3 == 0)
anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 652;
if(j3 == 1)
anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 567;
if(j3 == 2)
anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 234;
if(j3 == 3)
anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 244;
if(j3 == 4)
anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 213;
anIntArray1094[anInt1133] = class30_sub2_sub4_sub2.anInt1558;
anIntArray1091[anInt1133] = i1;
anIntArray1092[anInt1133] = j1;
anInt1133++;
} else
if(j3 == 2)
{
aStringArray1199[anInt1133] = “Take @lre@” + class8.aString170;
anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 234;
anIntArray1094[anInt1133] = class30_sub2_sub4_sub2.anInt1558;
anIntArray1091[anInt1133] = i1;
anIntArray1092[anInt1133] = j1;
anInt1133++;
}

                        aStringArray1199[anInt1133] = "Examine @lre@" + class8.aString170;
                        anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 1448;
                        anIntArray1094[anInt1133] = class30_sub2_sub4_sub2.anInt1558;
                        anIntArray1091[anInt1133] = i1;
                        anIntArray1092[anInt1133] = j1;
                        anInt1133++;
                    }[/code][/quote]

I have the same thing.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]Picking up custom item
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Only thing I’ve been able to come up with is in the client class, client sided.

Search for(int j3 = 4; j3 >= 0; j3–)

Everything below that is for dropped items. Take, examine, etc… But I cannot figure out what is wrong with it. Mine has the … above the take option and it looks like this.

[code=java]
for(int j3 = 4; j3 >= 0; j3–)
if(class8.aStringArray168 != null && class8.aStringArray168[j3] != null)
{
aStringArray1199[anInt1133] = class8.aStringArray168[j3] + " @lre@" + class8.aString170;
if(j3 == 0)
anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 652;
if(j3 == 1)
anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 567;
if(j3 == 2)
anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 234;
if(j3 == 3)
anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 244;
if(j3 == 4)
anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 213;
anIntArray1094[anInt1133] = class30_sub2_sub4_sub2.anInt1558;
anIntArray1091[anInt1133] = i1;
anIntArray1092[anInt1133] = j1;
anInt1133++;
} else
if(j3 == 2)
{
aStringArray1199[anInt1133] = “Take @lre@” + class8.aString170;
anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 234;
anIntArray1094[anInt1133] = class30_sub2_sub4_sub2.anInt1558;
anIntArray1091[anInt1133] = i1;
anIntArray1092[anInt1133] = j1;
anInt1133++;
}

                        aStringArray1199[anInt1133] = "Examine @lre@" + class8.aString170;
                        anIntArray1093[anInt1133] = 1448;
                        anIntArray1094[anInt1133] = class30_sub2_sub4_sub2.anInt1558;
                        anIntArray1091[anInt1133] = i1;
                        anIntArray1092[anInt1133] = j1;

item.title: [Delta]Picking up custom item
item.dc:creator: @gangsta_tony gangsta tony
item.description:
@gangsta_tony wrote:

[quote=“halflive9, post:3, topic:454198”]I think that you have to edit the ints of that item. In your client go to class8.java. Search for the name of the item and something like:

if(i = ####) { ... }
See if there is the … option. Else try to search for the “…” in class8.java and see if it has again something like:

if(i = ####) { addOption(..); }[/quote]
It doesn’t have it.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]Picking up custom item
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

I think that you have to edit the ints of that item. In your client go to class8.java. Search for the name of the item and something like:

if(i = ####) { ... }
See if there is the … option. Else try to search for the “…” in class8.java and see if it has again something like:

if(i = ####) { addOption(..); }
